html: I graduated college in December of 1997 with about 25k in student loan debt. I went to a state school, had some scholarships, and worked 30+ hours a week throughout college, and I still owed about 25k. Which is way less than a grad in a similar situation *today* would owe.

html: $1.5 trillion is now tied up in student debt. It is destroying lives and it's a drag on our whole economy. We need transformative change. It's time to eliminate all student debt and guarantee debt and tuition-free public colleges.
text:
$1.5 trillion is now tied up in student debt. It is destroying lives and it's a drag on our whole economy.

We need transformative change. It's time to eliminate all student debt and guarantee debt and tuition-free public colleges.

html: I’ve gone to my masjid since I was a kid. Despite increased islamophobia, it’s always felt safe. The Imam today: I know we’ve enjoyed being able to come and go freely from the masjid, but we would be defenseless to protect you if something happened. So, we’ll now have security.
text:
I’ve gone to my masjid since I was a kid. Despite increased islamophobia, it’s always felt safe.

The Imam today: I know we’ve enjoyed being able to come and go freely from the masjid, but we would be defenseless to protect you if something happened. So, we’ll now have security.

html: The job of Attorney General is to protect the people of Minnesota. When the President or the federal government harms the people of Minnesota, I'll use the power of my office to protect Minnesotans.
text: The job of Attorney General is to protect the people of Minnesota. When the President or the federal government harms the people of Minnesota, I'll use the power of my office to protect Minnesotans.

html: The declaration, which POTUS admitted is unnecessary, is also an overreach of executive power that hurts the people of MN and every state in the long term by manufacturing a crisis that endangers the constitutional balance of powers.
text: The declaration, which POTUS admitted is unnecessary, is also an overreach of executive power that hurts the people of MN and every state in the long term by manufacturing a crisis that endangers the constitutional balance of powers.

html: POTUS declaration would cause short and long-term harm to the people of MN. It hurts MN by likely diverting funds legally appropriated to the National Guard, which responds to natural disasters, keeps people safe, and supports communities everywhere in MN.

text:
Let me congratulate the @fightfor15 movement for winning another historic victory.

The American people understand that we must raise the federal minimum wage from a starvation wage of $7.25 an hour to a living wage – at least $15 an hour. 

And that is exactly what we'll do!https://twitter.com/fightfor15/status/1096490210404139008 …

html: Justice Jackson observed that broad emergency powers were “something the forefathers omitted” from the Constitution. “They knew what emergencies were, knew the pressures they engender for authoritative action, knew, too, how they afford a ready pretext for usurpation,” he wrote.

html: Today in 1922, researchers at the University of Toronto announced the discovery of insulin. They sold the patent for $1 so it would be available to all. 97 years later, Eli Lilly is charging ~$300 and Americans die because they can’t afford their medication. Outrageous.
text:
Today in 1922, researchers at the University of Toronto announced the discovery of insulin. They sold the patent for $1 so it would be available to all.

97 years later, Eli Lilly is charging ~$300 and Americans die because they can’t afford their medication. Outrageous.

html: Re racial reconciliation, “Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is farthest thing from it. [It is] a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us. Cynics say no. Saying “yes” begins things. Saying “yes” is how things grow.” Stephen Colbert

html: Why racial reconciliation? “Thus to forgive is indeed best form of self-interest since anger, resentment, revenge are corrosive of summum bonum, that greatest good, communal harmony that enhances humanity and personhood of all.” ― Tutu, No Future Without Forgiveness
text:
Why racial reconciliation? “Thus to forgive is indeed best form of self-interest since anger, resentment, revenge are corrosive of  summum bonum, that greatest good, communal harmony that enhances humanity and personhood of all.” 
― Tutu, No Future Without Forgiveness

html: On racial reconciliation, I often turn to Bishop Tutu. He wrote: “One of the most blasphemous consequences of injustice, especially racist injustice, is that it can make a child of God doubt that he or she is a child of God.” ― Desmond Tutu, No Future Without Forgiveness

html: You may write me down in history With your bitter, twisted lies, You may trod me in the very dirt But still, like dust, I'll rise. Does my sassiness upset you? Why are you beset with gloom? ’Cause I walk like I've got oil wells Pumping in my living room. #mayaangelou @politicopic.twitter.com/AhS0UonqKQ
text:
You may write me down in history
With your bitter, twisted lies,
You may trod me in the very dirt
But still, like dust, I'll rise.

Does my sassiness upset you?
Why are you beset with gloom?
’Cause I walk like I've got oil wells
Pumping in my living room.
#mayaangelou
@politicopic.twitter.com/AhS0UonqKQ

html: Two-fifths (40 percent) of African Americans and one-third (34 percent) of Latinos would get a raise if the federal minimum wage were increased to $15
text: Two-fifths (40 percent) of African Americans and one-third (34 percent) of Latinos would get a raise if the federal minimum wage were increased to $15

html: A $15 minimum wage would begin to reverse decades of growing pay inequality between the lowest-paid workers and the middle class. The stagnant minimum wage accounts for 48% of the increase in inequality between women at the middle and bottom of the wage distribution since 1979.
text: A $15 minimum wage would begin to reverse decades of growing pay inequality between the lowest-paid workers and the middle class. The stagnant minimum wage accounts for 48% of the increase in inequality between women at the middle and bottom of the wage distribution since 1979.

html: Gradually raising the federal minimum wage to $15 by 2024 would lift pay for 41 million workers—nearly 30 percent of the U.S. workforce.
text: Gradually raising the federal minimum wage to $15 by 2024 would lift pay for 41 million workers—nearly 30 percent of the U.S. workforce.

html: Since the @fightfor15 was launched by striking fast-food workers in 2012, states representing approximately 21 percent of the U.S. workforce—CA, Mass, NY, and the DC—have approved raising their minimum wages to $15 an hour. @USProgressives
text: Since the @fightfor15 was launched by striking fast-food workers in 2012, states representing approximately 21 percent of the U.S. workforce—CA, Mass, NY, and the DC—have approved raising their minimum wages to $15 an hour. @USProgressives

html: The federal minimum wage is just $7.25 and has not increased since 2009. The Raise the Wage Act of 2019 would gradually raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour by 2024. @USProgressives
text: The federal minimum wage is just $7.25 and has not increased since 2009. The Raise the Wage Act of 2019 would gradually raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour by 2024. @USProgressives

text:
Yesterday, Congress voted to lift a 181 year ban on headwear to make the #116thCongress more inclusive for all. 

I thank my colleagues for welcoming me, and I look forward to the day we lift the Muslim ban separating families all over the U.S. from their loved ones.

html: For over a year, I have been pushing to end U.S. involvement in Yemen. I have invoked the War Powers Act twice but Republicans blocked my efforts. This issue is so important to me and I’m glad that the Senate took the first step to finally end our support for Saudi war crimes.
text:
For over a year, I have been pushing to end U.S. involvement in Yemen.

I have invoked the War Powers Act twice but Republicans blocked my efforts.

This issue is so important to me and I’m glad that the Senate took the first step to finally end our support for Saudi war crimes.

html: Wow! Wow! Wow! With a quarter of the vote counted in Missouri, 62% of voters are rejecting state’s “right-to-work” law. Only 50%+1 is needed to overturn the anti-union law. If the law is overturned (especially if it is overturned by a wide margin) that’s a huge win for @AFLCIO.
text:
Wow! Wow! Wow!

With a quarter of the vote counted in Missouri, 62% of voters are rejecting state’s “right-to-work” law. Only 50%+1 is needed to overturn the anti-union law.

If the law is overturned (especially if it is overturned by a wide margin) that’s a huge win for @AFLCIO.
